erikmisc 0.1.2

    • Key variables completion

Complete multiple key ID variables

Source: R/e_complete_multiple_keys_ALL.R
e_complete_multiple_keys.Rd

When data are combined from multiple sources and multiple identifier keys (ID) are used, sometimes in combinations, then we may want to provide the most complete set of the IDs for each observation. By definition, each key value is unique within its column to identify an observational unit.

e_complete_multiple_keys(
  dat_data,
  dat_keys = NULL,
  col_keys = c("a", "b", "c")
)

Arguments

dat_data

data frame with a set of variables that are keys
dat_keys

optional data frame with only key variables, more complete than set in dat_data
col_keys

key columns names

Value

dat_data with updated key columns

Examples


dat_data <-
  tibble::tribble(
    ~a, ~b, ~c, ~x, ~d1, ~d2
  ,  1, 11, NA, NA,   1,  20
  ,  1, NA, 10, NA,   2,  21
  ,  2, NA, NA, NA,   3,  22
  , NA, 22, 20, NA,   4,  23
  ,  2, NA, 20, NA,   5,  24
  ,  3, 33, NA, NA,   6,  25
  ,  4, NA, 40, NA,   7,  26
  ,  5, NA, NA, NA,   8,  27
  ,  6, NA, 60, NA,   9,  28
  ,  6, NA, 60, NA,  10,  29
  , NA, 77, NA, NA,  11,  30
  , NA, 88, 80, NA,  12,  31
  , NA, 88, NA, NA,  13,  32
  , NA, NA, NA, NA,  14,  33
  )

dat_data_updated <-
  e_complete_multiple_keys(
    dat_data
  , dat_keys = NULL
  , col_keys = c("a", "b", "c", "x")
  )

dat_data_updated %>% print(n=Inf)

#> # A tibble: 14 x 6
#>        a     b     c x        d1    d2
#>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl> <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1     1    11    10 NA        1    20
#>  2     1    11    10 NA        2    21
#>  3     2    22    20 NA        3    22
#>  4     2    22    20 NA        4    23
#>  5     2    22    20 NA        5    24
#>  6     3    33    NA NA        6    25
#>  7     4    NA    40 NA        7    26
#>  8     5    NA    NA NA        8    27
#>  9     6    NA    60 NA        9    28
#> 10     6    NA    60 NA       10    29
#> 11    NA    77    NA NA       11    30
#> 12    NA    88    80 NA       12    31
#> 13    NA    88    80 NA       13    32
#> 14    NA    NA    NA NA       14    33
